title: distinctive marine species from various categories
text:
Dive into a captivating visual journey through the breathtaking world of distinctive marine species. On this website page, you’ll encounter a series of stunning photographs showcasing some of the ocean’s most extraordinary inhabitants. From the mesmerizing colors of the leafy sea dragon to the formidable strength of the mantis shrimp, our collection of images captures the sheer diversity and beauty that thrives beneath the waves.
Click on the Images for More Information: By clicking on each picture, you can access in-depth information about the featured marine species. Learn about their habits, habitats, unique characteristics, and the challenges they face in today’s changing world. Discover how these remarkable creatures contribute to the delicate balance of ocean ecosystems.









Mantis shrimp





Nautilus





Leafy Seadragon





Nudibranch





Mola Mola(The ocean sunfish)

title: hi i am shuohang
text:

library(shiny)

# Define UI for application that draws a histogram
ui <- fluidPage(
  
  # Application title
  titlePanel("Old Faithful Geyser Data"),
  
  # Sidebar with a slider input for number of bins 
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      sliderInput("bins",
                  "Number of bins:",
                  min = 1,
                  max = 50,
                  value = 30)
    ),
    
    # Show a plot of the generated distribution
    mainPanel(
      plotOutput("distPlot"),
      img(src="tur.png",height=140,width=400),
      
      
    )
  )
)

# Define server logic required to draw a histogram
server <- function(input, output) {
  
  output$distPlot <- renderPlot({
    # generate bins based on input$bins from ui.R
    x    <- faithful[, 2]
    bins <- seq(min(x), max(x), length.out = input$bins + 1)
    
    # draw the histogram with the specified number of bins
    hist(x, breaks = bins, col = 'darkgray', border = 'white',
         xlab = 'Waiting time to next eruption (in mins)',
         main = 'Histogram of waiting times')
  })
}

# Run the application 
shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)

Shiny applications not supported in static R Markdown documents
